org.gearvrf

Class GVRIndexBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRIndexBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrettyPrint

    public class GVRIndexBuffer
extends GVRHybridObject
implements PrettyPrint
    Contains face indices for an indexed triangle mesh.

    Each entry references a vertex in the GVRVertexBuffer associated with the mesh. The indices may be either char or int. The size and type of the indices are established when the buffer is constructed and cannot be subsequently changed.

    See Also:
    GVRMesh, GVRVertexBuffer

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRIndexBuffer

        public GVRIndexBuffer(GVRContext gvrContext,
                      int bytesPerIndex,
                      int indexCount)
        Constructs an index buffer of a give size and type.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - GVRContext to associate index buffer with.
        bytesPerIndex - Number of bytes per index: may be 2 or 4.
        indexCount - Number of indices in the buffer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bytesPerIndex is not 2 or 4.

    • Method Detail

      • asCharBuffer

        public java.nio.CharBuffer asCharBuffer()
        Get the triangle vertex indices of the mesh as a CharBuffer.

        The indices for each triangle are represented as a packed char triplet, where t0 is the first triangle, t1 is the second, etc.:

        { t0[0], t0[1], t0[2], t1[0], t1[1], t1[2], ...}

        Face indices may also be int. If you have specified char indices, this function will throw an exception.

        Returns:
        CharBuffer with the packed triangle index data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index buffer is not char
        See Also:
        asIntBuffer()

      • asIntBuffer

        public java.nio.IntBuffer asIntBuffer()
        Get the triangle vertex indices of the mesh as a IntBuffer.

        The indices for each triangle are represented as a packed int triplet, where t0 is the first triangle, t1 is the second, etc.:

        { t0[0], t0[1], t0[2], t1[0], t1[1], t1[2], ...}

        Face indices may also be char. If you have specified char indices, this function will throw an exception.

        Returns:
        IntBuffer with the packed triangle index data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index buffer is not int
        See Also:
        asCharBuffer()

        The indices for each triangle are represented as a packed int triplet, where t0 is the first triangle, t1 is the second, etc.:

        { t0[0], t0[1], t0[2], t1[0], t1[1], t1[2], ...}

        Face indices may also be char. If you have specified char indices, this function will throw an exception.

      • setShortVec

        public void setShortVec(char[] data)
        Updates the indices in the index buffer from a Java char array. All of the entries of the input char array are copied into the storage for the index buffer. The new indices must be the same size as the old indices - the index buffer size cannot be changed.
        Parameters:
        data - char array containing the new values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if char array is wrong size

      • setShortVec

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if char array is wrong size

      • getIndexCount

        public int getIndexCount()
        Get the number of indices in this index buffer.

        This value is established when the index buffer is constructed and cannot be subsequently changed. If no data has been provided, the index count is 0.

        Returns:
        number of indices in the buffer.

      • getIndexSize

        public int getIndexSize()
        Get the number of bytes per index.

        This value is established when the index buffer is constructed and cannot be subsequently changed. It will be eithr 2 or 4.

        Returns:
        number of bytes per index.
